forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southwest wind 6 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening blankets Downtown San Francisco, gentle rain taps at windows, weaving a rhythmic serenade against the backdrop of golden streetlights shimmering through the droplets. The forecast paints a picture of a night steeped in moisture, with temperatures settling around a hushed 52 degrees, creeping upwards to a cooler 54 by nightfall. Clouds alternate between thick and heavy, casting shadows across the cityscape, while south-southwest winds swirl softly, whispering through the dampened air. A full-fledged downpour is anticipated, with new rainfall adding a glistening touch to the already sodden streets.

Looking towards Saturday, a delicate balance of sun and rain is in store, as clouds break cautiously to reveal hints of blue. The high will hover near a modest 58 degrees, with a subtle descent to 54 by afternoon. A lively southwest breeze adds a breath of freshness, though one must remain wary of lingering patches of fog and the marine layer that drapes unpredictably across the bay. For those traversing the city, a light raincoat paired with a warm scarf is prudent, while sturdy shoes withstand the slick streets. With these conditions, an afternoon stroll through the nearby parks or a quiet visit to a local café could be a fitting way to immerse oneself in the atmospheric embrace of this rainy November day, catching up with a favorite book or savoring the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee as the rain continues to dance outside.
